EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory Interface at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
• Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
• Burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5)
  – Pickup position: (2.5, 17.5)
  – Drop position: (4.5, 17.5)
Use-case: Feeds the factory production (copper cable creation) by channeling items toward the assembling unit.

### Depot Belt System at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden chest (belt depot) successfully placed at (3.5, 15.5)
• Adjacent transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5)
• Depot burner inserter at (3.5, 14.5)
  – Pickup position: (3.5, 15.5)
  – Drop position: (3.5, 13.5)
Use-case: Serves as an isolated belt target to receive and route items from the extraction system through a dedicated connection.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors (Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, 217)
 – Issue: Repeated failures occur because transport belts are being connected directly to an entity identified as a Prototype.SteamEngine.
 – Tip: Always ensure that the target of a transport belt connection is a proper inserter (or an entity accepting items via an inserter) rather than a steam engine proxy.

• Placement Range Error (Step 212)
 – Issue: Wooden chest placement failed because the target position (3.5, 15.5) is too far from the player at (0, 0).
 – Tip: Move closer to the intended placement position (within the maximum allowed range) before attempting to place the entity.

• Inventory Shortage Error (Step 213)
 – Issue: Attempt to place a wooden chest failed due to the absence of the chest in the inventory.
 – Tip: Verify that the required entity is available in the inventory before initiating a placement action.

• Undefined Variable Error (Step 212)
 – Issue: A NameError occurred because ‘target_chest’ was not defined.
 – Tip: Confirm variable names and ensure that all referenced variables are properly declared prior to use.
